translation.eng: The mother was working on a mat sitting on the floor. It was a hot day.
A little boy was beside his mother making arrows.
The mother got thirsty.
She said, “My child, I got thirsty. Please give me a drink.

transcript.default: wim̓aaqƛs, waaʔat t̓an̓aʔi, n̓aacsasuuk ʔan c̓iiḥatiqiiɬ.

transcription.default: wim̓aaqƛs waaʔat t̓an̓aʔi n̓aacsasuuk ʔan c̓iiḥatiqiiɬ

translation.eng: I can’t. You can see I’m making arrows,” said the son.
“Go, my child! Get me a drink,” she repeated.
“I can’t, I said. I’m working,” the child repeated.

transcript.default: ʔuuḥtaasaʔi t̓een̓a, xaašxiipšiƛcums. ɬaakcaḥicumʔick wik̓iituk ʔumʔiiqsu xaašxiipšiƛquus.

transcription.default: ʔuuḥtaasaʔi t̓een̓a xaašxiipšiƛcums ɬaakcaḥicumʔick wik̓iituk ʔumʔiiqsu xaašxiipšiƛquus

translation.eng: “Behave my child. I might turn into a blue jay. You might be poor without a mother if I turn into a blue jay.
Go ahead and turn into a blue jay. I don’t care,” the child repeated.
He had just stopped talking.

transcript.default: naʔiičiƛ, xaaš xaaš xaaš xaaš, wawaaʔi.

transcription.default: naʔiičiƛ xaaš xaaš xaaš xaaš wawaaʔi

translation.eng: Then he heard something saying “_xa:š xa:š xa:š xa:š_”.
He looked up just in time to see a blue jay flying up.
He ran to get the pail right away.

transcript.default: wiiksas ʔaaʔaanaqḥʷa, wawaaqčik kamatqukqčik ʔucačiƛ č̓aʔakʔi.

transcription.default: wiiksas ʔaaʔaanaqḥʷa wawaaqčik kamatqukqčik ʔucačiƛ č̓aʔakʔi

translation.eng: “I didn’t really mean it,” he said as he ran towards the river.
He dipped the bucket in and ran back home.

transcript.default: nicwiiʔap kacutum ƛawaʔii xaašxiipšiƛ̓i, maa ʔuum naqšiʔi, wiiksas ʔaaʔaanaqḥʷa, maa naqšiʔi, waa waa.

transcription.default: nicwiiʔap kacutum ƛawaʔii xaašxiipšiƛ̓i maa ʔuum naqšiʔi wiiksas ʔaaʔaanaqḥʷa maa naqšiʔi waa waa

translation.eng: He dipped the dipper in, and went near the one that turned into a blue jay and said, “Here mom, have a drink; I didn’t really mean it; here, have a drink.”

transcript.default: ʔanasiɬaƛquuč xaaš, xaaš, wawaaqčik kʷiscačiƛ matšiƛ.

transcription.default: ʔanasiɬaƛquuč xaaš xaaš wawaaqčik kʷiscačiƛ matšiƛ

translation.eng: All she said was “_xa:š_, _xa:š_,” as she flew from one place to another.
The blue jay flew out and up onto a tree.
There it sat, crying “_xa:š_, _xa:š_.”

transcript.default: ƛaawuɬšiʔaƛquuč maʔiƛqacʔi ʔanasiɬaƛquuč kʷiscačiƛ mataasiƛ suč̓as.

translation.eng: Whenever the little boy got close, it would just fly away to another tree.

transcript.default: wik wiikʕaƛp̓ičḥ maʔiƛqacʔi, maa, ʔuum naqšiʔi, wawaa ʕiiḥp̓ičḥ.

translation.eng: The little boy did not stop and kept saying while crying, “Here, mom, have a drink.”

transcript.default: huḥtakšiƛ maʔiƛqacʔi ʔan ʔaanaqḥ xaašxiipšiƛuk ʔumʔiiqsu.

transcription.default: huḥtakšiƛ maʔiƛqacʔi ʔan ʔaanaqḥ xaašxiipšiƛuk ʔumʔiiqsu

translation.eng: The little boy knew now that his mother really turned into a blue jay.

translation.eng: He sat down and cried; “Oh, mother, I did not really mean it,” he said crying.

transcription.default: ʔaanaqḥuk xaašxiipšiƛ ʔumʔiiqsu ʔunw̓iiƛḥ ʔan wiiksa naʔaa qʷiyaatʔitq ʔaʔumʔat naquutiʔis waaʔat

translation.eng: His mother really turned into a blue jay, because he did not listen when he was first asked to get her water to drink.
Lesson — You listen when someone tells you to do something.

transcript.default: wik naaw̓aḥi qiip̓atʕaƛ̓atquuk ʔan ʔuušsuuqstuʔaqƛ̓atsuu ʔayup̓itʕaƛ̓atquu.

transcription.default: wik naaw̓aḥi qiip̓atʕaƛ̓atquuk ʔan ʔuušsuuqstuʔaqƛ̓atsuu ʔayup̓itʕaƛ̓atquu

translation.eng: Don’t wait until they have to repeat it to you, because they will get angry at you when they have to keep repeating.
You should do it right away whatever you are asked to do.
